neuropilot.websocketUrl.description: The URL to connect to the Neuro API
neuropilot.websocketUrl.deprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to `neuropilot.connection.websocketUrl`

neuropilot.gameName.description: The name to use for this "game"
neuropilot.gameName.deprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to `neuropilot.connection.gameName`

neuropilot.initialContext.description: The initial context to sent to Neuro-sama (or whatever is connected to NeuroPilot)
neuropilot.initialContext.deprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to `neuropilot.connection.initialContext`

neuropilot.currentlyAsNeuroAPI.markdownDescription:
Who is currently acting as the Neuro API server?
This only changes the name in certain areas (such as Copilot-mode requests or Git commit messages) due to limitations.

You can add custom characters using `settings.json` if you ignore the lint error from VS Code.

(Most) names mentioned here are not associated with NeuroPilot.

neuropilot.docsURL.markdownDescription:
If you're using a mirror of the docs site, put its URL here.

You will most likely not need to change this, unless you are modifying the docs themselves.

neuropilot.beforeContext.description: The number of lines before the cursor position to include as context when editing a file or sending a completion request

neuropilot.afterContext.description: The number of lines after the cursor position to include as context when editing a file or sending a completion request

neuropilot.maxCompletions.description: The maximum number of completions to request

enumDescriptions: Only request completions when the user explicitly invokes the completion provider
Automatically request completions when the user stops typing

neuropilot.timeout.description: The timeout in milliseconds for completions and chat responses in ms

neuropilot.includePattern.markdownDescription: A case-sensitive glob pattern for files Neuro is allowed to open, i.e. she will be unable to open files that don't match this pattern. Separate multiple patterns with a newline. Patterns without a slash will match any file or folder with that name.
neuropilot.includePattern.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to `neuropilot.access.includePattern`.

neuropilot.excludePattern.markdownDescription: A case-sensitive glob pattern for files Neuro is not allowed to open. Applied after the include pattern. Files and folders beginning with a dot are always excluded, regardless of this setting. Separate multiple patterns with a newline. Patterns without a slash will match any file or folder with that name.
neuropilot.excludePattern.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to `neuropilot.access.excludePattern`.

name.description: The name Neuro can reference this terminal by

path.description: The path to the terminal executable

args.description: The arguments to pass to the terminal executable

neuropilot.terminals.markdownDescription:
A list of terminals Neuro can use.
Changing this requires a [permission reload](command:neuropilot.reloadPermissions).

neuropilot.showTimeOnTerminalStart.markdownDescription: Display the date and time of when a terminal is started by Neuro.

neuropilot.terminalContextDelay.markdownDescription: The time in ms to wait for the terminal to print more output before sending context to Neuro. This is to prevent sending multiple context messages if the terminal doesn't print fast enough.

neuropilot.allowUnsafePaths.markdownDescription:
Allow Neuro to view & edit files and folders in unsafe paths. These include:
- files/folders starting with a '.'
- parent directories and directories outside the workspace
- Environmental variables

Note that your include/exclude patterns are still respected.
neuropilot.allowUnsafePaths.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting is no longer used. Please use the more granular access permissions such as `neuropilot.access.dotFiles` and `neuropilot.access.externalFiles`.

neuropilot.allowRunningAllTasks.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro to run all tasks regardless of their prefix in their 'detail' key.
neuropilot.allowRunningAllTasks.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to neuropilot.actions.allowRunningAllTasks.

neuropilot.sendNewLintingProblemsOn.description: If a new linting problem appears, on what condition should it be sent to Neuro?
enumItemLabels: If it's in the current file
If it's any Neuro-safe file in the workspace
enumDescriptions: Only when Neuro explicitly checks for it.
If a new problem appears in the file she is currently viewing.
When a new problem appears anywhere in the workspace.

neuropilot.sendSaveNotifications.markdownDescription: Automatically send save notifications to Neuro.

neuropilot.requestExpiryTimeout.markdownDescription:
The time to wait (in milliseconds) before automatically rejecting Copilot-mode action requests from Neuro.
Setting this to 0 will cause the requests to never expire.

neuropilot.hideCopilotRequests.markdownDescription: Don't immediately show Copilot-mode action requests, requiring clicking the status bar item to reveal them.
neuropilot.hideCopilotRequests.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to neuropilot.actions.hideCopilotRequests.

neuropilot.cursorFollowsNeuro.markdownDescription: Make the real cursor follow Neuro's cursor.

enumDescriptions: Always ask where to open the docs
Always open docs in your browser
Always open docs in a new WebView window
neuropilot.defaultOpenDocsWindow.markdownDescription:
Choose where to open docs links.

This applies to both docs commands.

neuropilot.disabledActions.markdownDescription:
List of action names that Neuro can't use, regardless of other permission settings.

Requires [reloading permissions](command:neuropilot.reloadPermissions) if changed.
neuropilot.disabledActions.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has moved to neuropilot.actions.disabledActions

neuropilot.sendContentsOnFileChange.markdownDescription: Send contents of a file to Neuro when you switch to it? If false, Neuro will still know what file you switched to, but won't get the contents. Neuro will never get the contents or the name of files that aren't Neuro-safe.

neuropilot.cursorPositionContextStyle.markdownDescription: The style to use for specifying the cursor position in context messages.
markdownEnumDescriptions: Cursor position will not be mentioned to Neuro

neuropilot.lineNumberContextFormat.markdownDescription: The format to use for line numbers in context messages. This format will be prepended to every line. Use `{n}` for the line number. Edit in settings.json for examples.

neuropilot.enableCancelEvents.markdownDescription: Whether to enable cancellation events for RCE. See [this docs page](https://vsc-neuropilot.github.io/docs/references/rce#cancellation-events).
neuropilot.enableCancelEvents.markdownDeprecationMessage: This setting has been moved to neuropilot.actions.enableCancelEvents.

neuropilot.permission.openFiles.markdownDescription: Let Neuro open files in the workspace. For security reasons, Neuro cannot open anything that starts with a dot or has a parent folder that starts with a dot (e.g. `.git`, `.vscode`, ...), unless you enable Allow Unsafe Paths.

neuropilot.permission.editActiveDocument.markdownDescription: Let Neuro edit the active file directly.

neuropilot.permission.create.markdownDescription: Let Neuro create new files and folders in the workspace.

neuropilot.permission.rename.markdownDescription: Let Neuro rename files and folders in the workspace.

neuropilot.permission.delete.markdownDescription: Let Neuro delete files and folders in the workspace.

neuropilot.permission.runTasks.markdownDescription: Let Neuro run workspace tasks defined in `tasks.json`.

neuropilot.permission.requestCookies.markdownDescription: Neuro may ask for cookies while coding.

neuropilot.permission.gitOperations.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro to perform Git operations in the workspace.

neuropilot.permission.gitTags.markdownDescription:
Allow Neuro to create and delete tags in Git repositories.
Also requires [Git Operations](vscode://settings/neuropilot.permission.gitOperations) permission to be enabled.

neuropilot.permission.gitRemotes.markdownDescription:
Allow Neuro to push, pull and fetch commits.
Also requires [Git Operations](vscode://settings/neuropilot.permission.gitOperations) permission to be enabled.

neuropilot.permission.editRemoteData.markdownDescription:
Allow Neuro to add, remove and rename remotes.
Also requires [Git Operations](vscode://settings/neuropilot.permission.gitOperations) & [Git Remotes](vscode://settings/neuropilot.permission.gitRemotes) permissions to be enabled.

neuropilot.permission.gitConfigs.markdownDescription:
Allow Neuro to view and edit Git configuration in the workspace.
Also requires [Git Operations](vscode://settings/neuropilot.permission.gitOperations) permission to be enabled.

neuropilot.permission.terminalAccess.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro __direct terminal access__. Be very careful with this.

neuropilot.permission.accessLintingAnaly.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro to get access to linting problems within loaded files.

neuropilot.permission.getUserSelection.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro to see your cursor position and selection within Neuro-safe files.

neuropilot.access.dotFiles.markdownDescription: Allows Neuro to access files and folders beginning with a dot.

neuropilot.access.externalFiles.markdownDescription: Allows Neuro to access files and folders outside the current workspace.

neuropilot.access.environmentVariables.markdownDescription: Allows Neuro to use environment variables in paths. This probably won't work, this security setting is just in case it somehow does.

neuropilot.access.includePattern.markdownDescription:
A case-sensitive list of glob patterns for files Neuro is allowed to open, i.e. she will be unable to open files that don't match this pattern.

Patterns without a slash will match any file or folder with that name.

neuropilot.access.excludePattern.markdownDescription: A case-sensitive glob pattern for files Neuro is not allowed to open. Applied after the include pattern. Patterns without a slash will match any file or folder with that name.

neuropilot.connection.websocketUrl.description: The URL to connect to the Neuro API

neuropilot.connection.gameName.description: The name to use for this "game"

neuropilot.connection.initialContext.default: You are using an extension in Visual Studio Code that allows you to code together with Vedal.
neuropilot.connection.initialContext.description: The initial context to sent to Neuro-sama (or whatever is connected to NeuroPilot)

neuropilot.connection.autoConnect.markdownDescription: Whether to auto-connect to the Neuro API on extension setup.

neuropilot.connection.retryInterval.markdownDescription:
The delay (in ms) between NeuroPilot retrying connections to NeuroPilot.

Set to 0 if you want to retry as soon as possible.

neuropilot.connection.retryAmount.markdownDescription:
The amount of retries to connect to the Neuro API if it fails.

The amount of tries total will be (this setting) + 1.

Set to 0 to disallow retries.

neuropilot.actions.disabledActions.markdownDescription:
List of action names that Neuro can't use, regardless of other permission settings.

Requires [reloading permissions](command:neuropilot.reloadPermissions) if changed.

neuropilot.actions.hideCopilotRequests.markdownDescription: Don't immediately show Copilot-mode action requests, requiring clicking the status bar item to reveal them.

neuropilot.actions.allowRunningAllTasks.markdownDescription: Allow Neuro to run all tasks regardless of their prefix in their 'detail' key.

neuropilot.actions.enableCancelEvents.markdownDescription: Whether to enable cancellation events for RCE. See [this docs page](https://vsc-neuropilot.github.io/docs/references/rce#cancellation-events).

neuropilot.actions.experimentalSchemas.markdownDescription:
Whether or not to toggle schemas that may use "unsupported" schema properties.

Requires reloading permissions if changed.

virtualWorkspaces.description: In virtual workspaces, Terminal, Tasks, Git support (restricted on web) and Copilot Chat mode (restricted on web) is not available.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: Terminal access, running tasks and accessing unsafe paths will be disabled for Neuro, regardless of settings.
